title: Introduction to the ncappc package
text: ncappc package flexible tool R : perform non-compartmental analysis (NCA) perform simulation-based posterior predictive checks (PPC) population models using NCA metrics. main tool ncappc package function ncappc(). order perform traditional NCA, mandatory argument function obsFile argument, name file observed concentration vs. time data. command compute NCA statstics individuals file output report results shown workflow Figure 1. Figure 1: Schematic work-flow ncappc() function ncappc package. Options NCA statistics computed report generated available, see ?ncappc. example, following code computes NCA metrics outputs R object: presence non-empty simFile argument (simulated concentration vs. time data) ncappc() function performs diagnostic tests related PK model addition performing traditional NCA. example, model defined NONMEM, produce simulated datasets using PsN command: created directory can create NCA metrics well PPC metrics using following command:
code: ncappc(obsFile = "file_with_observations.txt") data_1 <- tibble(   ID=1,   TIME = c(0,0.25,0.5,1,1.5,2,3,4,6,8,12,16,24),   DV=c(0, 0.07, 0.14, 0.21, 0.24, 0.27, 0.26, 0.25, 0.22, 0.19, 0.13, 0.081, 0.033) )       out <- ncappc(obsFile=data_1,               onlyNCA = T,               extrapolate = T,               printOut = F,               evid = FALSE,               noPlot = T)  out$ncaOutput %>% select(c(AUClast,AUCINF_pred,Cmax,Tmax)) AUClast AUCINF_pred Cmax Tmax 1 3.235439    3.524005 0.27    2 nca run1.mod -samples=1000 -columns=EVID,DOSE -dir=nca_ex_1 ncappc(concUnit="ng/ml", doseAmtNm = "DOSE")

title: Introduction to the ncappc package
text: NCA metrics estimated according traditional PK calculations. names various NCA metrics estimated package assigned mainly following names used WinNonlin. package accepts three different types drug administration, () iv-bolus, (ii) iv-infusion (iii) extra-vascular; ncappc also can accept non-steady state steady-state data. NCA metrics estimated reported ncappc listed . C0 C0 initial concentration dosing time. observed concentration dosing time, available. Otherwise approximated using following rules. iv-bolus data, log-linear back-extrapolation (see “backExtrap” argument) performed first two observations estimate C0, provided local slope negative. However, slope >=0 least one first two concentrations 0, first non-zero concentration used C0. types administration, C0 equal 0 non steady-state data steady-state data minimum value observed dosing intervals used estimate C0, provided “backExtrap” argument set “yes”. Cmax, Tmax Cmax_D Cmax Tmax value time maximum observed concentration, respectively. maximum concentration unique, first maximum used. steady state data, maximum value dosing intervals considered. Cmax_D dose normalized maximum observed concentration. Clast Tlast Clast Tlast last measurable positive concentration corresponding time, respectively. AUClast area concentration vs. time curve first observed last measurable concentration. AUMClast area first moment concentration vs. time curve first observed last measurable concentration. MRTlast Mean residence time first observed last measurable concentration. non-infusion models,MRTlast=AUMClastAUClastMRTlast = \frac{AUMClast}{AUClast} infusion models,MRTlast=AUMClastAUClast−TI2MRTlast = \frac{AUMClast}{AUClast}-\frac{TI}{2} TI infusion duration. No_points_Lambda_z No_points_Lambda_z number observed data points used determine best fitting regression line elimination phase. AUC_pBack_Ext_obs AUC_pBack_Ext_pred percentage AUC contributed back extrapolation estimate C0. rules estimate C0 given . AUClower_upper AUC concentration-time profile within user-specified window time provided “AUCTimeRange” argument. case empty “AUCTimeRange” argument, AUClower_upper equal AUClast. Rsq, Rsq_adjusted Corr_XY Regression coefficient regression line used estimate elimination rate constant. Rsq_adjusted adjusted value Rsq given following relation.Rsq_adjusted=1−(1−Rsq2)*(n−1)n−2Rsq\_adjusted = 1-\frac{(1-Rsq^2)*(n-1)}{n-2} n number points regression line. Corr_XY square root Rsq. Lambda_z Elimination rate constant estimated regression line representing terminal phase concentration-time profile. relation slope regression line Lambda_z :Lambda_z=−(slope)Lambda\_z = -(slope) Lambda_lower Lambda_upper Lower upper limit time values concentration-time profile used estimate Lambda_z, respectively, case “LambdaTimeRange” used specify time range. HL_Lambda_z Terminal half-life drug:HL_Lambda_z=ln2λzHL\_Lambda\_z = \frac{ln2}{\lambda_z} AUCINF_obs AUCINF_obs_D AUC estimated first sampled data extrapolated ∞{\infty}. extrapolation terminal phase based last observed concentration (Clastobs{Clast_obs}). equation used estimation given .AUCINF_obs=AUClast+Clast_obsλzAUCINF\_obs = AUClast+\frac{Clast\_obs}{\lambda_z} AUCINF_obs_D dose normalized AUCINF_obs. AUC_pExtrap_obs Percentage AUCINF_obs contributed extrapolation last sampling time ∞{\infty}.AUC_pExtrap_obs=AUCINF_obs−AUClastAUCINF_obs*100%AUC\_pExtrap\_obs = \frac{AUCINF\_obs-AUClast}{AUCINF\_obs}*100\% AUMCINF_obs AUMC estimated first sampled data extrapolated ∞{\infty}. extrapolation terminal phase based last observed concentration. equation used estimation given .AUMCINF_obs=AUMClast+Tlast*Clast_obsλz+Clast_obsλz2AUMCINF\_obs = AUMClast+\frac{Tlast*Clast\_obs}{\lambda_z}+\frac{Clast\_obs}{\lambda_{z}^2} AUMC_pExtrap_obs Percentage AUMCINF_obs contributed extrapolation last sampling time ∞{\infty}.AUMC_pExtrap_obs=AUMCINF_obs−AUMClastAUMCINF_obs*100%AUMC\_pExtrap\_obs = \frac{AUMCINF\_obs-AUMClast}{AUMCINF\_obs}*100\% Vz_obs Volume distribution estimated based total AUC using following equation.Vz_obs=Doseλz*AUCINF_obsVz\_obs = \frac{Dose}{\lambda_z*AUCINF\_obs} Cl_obs Total body clearance. Cl_obs=DoseAUCINF_obsCl\_obs = \frac{Dose}{AUCINF\_obs} AUCINF_pred AUCINF_pred_D AUC first sampled data extrapolated ∞{\infty}. extrapolation terminal phase based last predicted concentration obtained regression line used estimate Lambda_z (Clast_pred{Clast\_pred}). equation used estimation given .AUCINF_pred=AUClast+Clast_predλzAUCINF\_pred = AUClast+\frac{Clast\_pred}{\lambda_z} AUCINF_pred_D dose normalized AUCINF_pred. AUC_pExtrap_pred Percentage AUCINF_pred contributed extrapolation last sampling time ∞{\infty}.AUC_pExtrap_pred=AUCINF_pred−AUClastAUCINF_pred*100%AUC\_pExtrap\_pred = \frac{AUCINF\_pred-AUClast}{AUCINF\_pred}*100\% AUMCINF_pred AUMC estimated first sampled data extrapolated ∞{\infty}. extrapolation terminal phase based last predicted concentration obtained regression line used estimate Lambda_z (Clast_pred{Clast\_pred}). equation used estimation given . AUMCINF_pred=AUMClast+Tlast*Clast_predλz+Clast_predλz2AUMCINF\_pred = AUMClast+\frac{Tlast*Clast\_pred}{\lambda_z}+\frac{Clast\_pred}{\lambda_{z}^2} AUMC_pExtrap_pred Percentage AUMCINF_pred contributed extrapolation last sampling time ∞{\infty}.AUMC_pExtrap_pred=AUMCINF_pred−AUMClastAUMCINF_pred*100%AUMC\_pExtrap\_pred = \frac{AUMCINF\_pred-AUMClast}{AUMCINF\_pred}*100\% Vz_pred Volume distribution estimated based total AUC using following equation.Vz_pred=Doseλz*AUCINF_predVz\_pred = \frac{Dose}{\lambda_z*AUCINF\_pred} Cl_pred Total body clearance.Cl_pred=DoseAUCINF_predCl\_pred = \frac{Dose}{AUCINF\_pred} MRTINF_obs Mean residence time first sampled time extrapolated ∞{\infty} based last observed concentration (Clast_obs{Clast\_obs}). non-infusion non steady-state data:MRTINF_obs=AUMCINF_obsAUCINF_obsMRTINF\_obs = \frac{AUMCINF\_obs}{AUCINF\_obs} infusion non steady-state data:MRTINF_obs=AUMCINF_obsAUCINF_obs−TI2MRTINF\_obs = \frac{AUMCINF\_obs}{AUCINF\_obs}-\frac{TI}{2} TI{TI} infusion duration. non-infusion steady-state data:MRTINF_obs=AUMCINF_obs|0τ+τ*(AUCINF_obs−AUC|0τ)AUCINF_obs|0τMRTINF\_obs = \frac{AUMCINF\_obs|_{0}^{\tau}+\tau*(AUCINF\_obs-AUC|_{0}^{\tau})}{AUCINF\_obs|_{0}^{\tau}} infusion steady-state data:MRTINF_obs=AUMCINF_obs|0τ+τ*(AUCINF_obs−AUC|0τ)AUCINF_obs|0τ−TI2MRTINF\_obs = \frac{AUMCINF\_obs|_{0}^{\tau}+\tau*(AUCINF\_obs-AUC|_{0}^{\tau})}{AUCINF\_obs|_{0}^{\tau}}-\frac{TI}{2} steady-state data τ{\tau} represents dosing interval. MRTINF_pred Mean residence time first sampled time extrapolated ∞{\infty} based last predicted concentration obtained regression line used estimate Lambda_z (Clast_pred{Clast\_pred}). non-infusion non steady-state data:MRTINF_pred=AUMCINF_predAUCINF_predMRTINF\_pred = \frac{AUMCINF\_pred}{AUCINF\_pred} infusion non steady-state data:MRTINF_pred=AUMCINF_predAUCINF_pred−TI2MRTINF\_pred = \frac{AUMCINF\_pred}{AUCINF\_pred}-\frac{TI}{2} TI{TI} infusion duration. non-infusion steady-state data:MRTINF_pred=AUMCINF_pred|0τ+τ*(AUCINF_pred−AUC|0τ)AUCINF_pred|0τMRTINF\_pred = \frac{AUMCINF\_pred|_{0}^{\tau}+\tau*(AUCINF\_pred-AUC|_{0}^{\tau})}{AUCINF\_pred|_{0}^{\tau}} infusion steady-state data:MRTINF_pred=AUMCINF_pred|0τ+τ*(AUCINF_pred−AUC|0τ)AUCINF_pred|0τ−TI2MRTINF\_pred = \frac{AUMCINF\_pred|_{0}^{\tau}+\tau*(AUCINF\_pred-AUC|_{0}^{\tau})}{AUCINF\_pred|_{0}^{\tau}}-\frac{TI}{2} steady-state data τ{\tau} represents dosing interval. Vss_obs Vss_pred estimate volume distribution steady-state.Vss_obs=MRTINF_obs*Cl_obsVss\_obs = MRTINF\_obs*Cl\_obsVss_pred=MRTINF_pred*Cl_predVss\_pred = MRTINF\_pred*Cl\_pred Tau dosing interval steady-state data. value assumed multiple doses. Cmin Tmin Cmin minimum concentration 0 Tau Tmin corresponding time steady-state data. Cavg average concentration 0 Tau steady-state data.Cavg=AUC|0TauTauCavg = \frac{AUC|_{0}^{Tau}}{Tau} p_Fluctuation Percentage fluctuation concentration 0 Tau steady-state data.p_Fluctuation=Cmax−CminCavg*100%p\_Fluctuation = \frac{Cmax-Cmin}{Cavg}*100\% Accumulation_IndexAccumulation_Index=11−e−λz*τAccumulation\_Index = \frac{1}{1-e^{-\lambda_{z}*\tau}} Clss estimate total body clearance steady-state data.Clss=DoseAUC|0τClss = \frac{Dose}{AUC|_{0}^{\tau}}

title: Introduction to the ncappc package
text: Area Curve AUC can estimated using either linear trapezoidal method log-linear trapezoidal method. shown linear approximation better method estimate area curve positive zero local slopes (increasing concentration peak), log-linear approximation method choice estimate area curve negative local slope (decreasing concentration) assuming plasma concentration decline mono-exponentially elimination phase. three different options available ncappc: “linear”, “log”, “linearup-logdown”. user can choose three methods estimating area zero-order moment (AUClast) first-order moment (AUMClast) curves first last sampling time. lower upper limit time range provided, AUC also calculated specified window time (AUClower_upper). “linear” option argument, namely “method” allows function employ linear trapezoidal approximation (Equations 1 2) estimate area zero first order moment curves. AUC|ii+1=Ci+1+Ci2*ΔtAUC|_{}^{+1} = \frac{C_{+1}+C_{}}{2}*\Delta{t}, Ci+1≥CiC_{+1} \geq C_{} (Equation 1) AUMC|ii+1=(Ci+1*ti+1)+(Ci*ti)2*ΔtAUMC|_{}^{+1} = \frac{(C_{+1}*t_{+1})+(C_{}*t_{})}{2}*\Delta{t}, Ci+1≥CiC_{+1} \geq C_{} (Equation 2) “log” options employ log trapezoidal approximation (Equations 3 4) estimate area zero first order moment curves. AUC|ii+1=Ci+1−Ciln(Ci+1Ci)*ΔtAUC|_{}^{+1} = \frac{C_{+1}-C_{}}{ln(\frac{C_{+1}}{C_{}})}*\Delta{t}, Ci+1<CiC_{+1} < C_{} (Equation 3)AUMC|ii+1=(Ci+1*ti+1)−(Ci*ti)ln(Ci+1Ci)*Δt−Ci+1−Ciln(Ci+1Ci)*Δt2AUMC|_{}^{+1} = \frac{(C_{+1}*t_{+1})-(C_{}*t_{})}{ln(\frac{C_{+1}}{C_{}})}*\Delta{t}-\frac{C_{+1}-C_{}}{ln(\frac{C_{+1}}{C_{}})}*\Delta{t}^2, ßCi+1<CißC_{+1} < C_{} (Equation 4) “log-linear” option employs linear trapezoidal approximation increasing concentration two consecutive observations peak concentration, uses log trapezoidal approximation declining concentration two consecutive observations. , Ci{C_i} plasma concentration time ti{t_i}, Δt{\Delta{t}} ti+1−ti{t_{+1}-t_{}} n{n} number data points. estimated segment AUC AUMC added obtain AUClast AUMClast, respectively. plasma concentration drug elimination phase assumed follow mono-exponential decay rate elimination, Lambda_z. extrapolation plasma concentration last sampling time infinity performed based regression line estimated elimination phase data. concentration data Cmax considered elimination phase data. following steps performed determine optimum regression line representing plasma concentration elimination phase. First, regression line obtained last three non-zero concentrations elimination phase regression coefficient R2{R^2} (Rsq) Adjusted R2{R^2} (Rsq_adjusted) calculated. Next, one data point time upto Cmax added set corresponding Rsq Rsq_adjusted calculated time. order extrapolate NCA metrics last observed value infinity terminal phase, ncappc functionality requires following two criteria satisfied. * Minimum three non-zero concentrations elimination phase * least one combinations data points elimination phase yields negative slope corresponding regression line individual data set satisfy mention criteria, NCA metrics individual extrapolated infinity elimination phase. Othrwise, regression line yielding highest Rsq_adjusted used estimate Lambda_z. regression line yields Rsq_adjustzed within 0.0001 highest Rsq_adjusted includes larger number data points, regression line used estimate Lambda_z. Lambda_z estimated negative slope selected regression line representing elimination phase concentration profile (Equation 5). number points used determine Lambda_z called No_points_Lambda_z. possible specify lower upper limit time calculation regression line elimination phase (Lambda_z_lower Lambda_z_upper, respectively). Lambda_z=−(slope)=ln(Clast)−ln(Clast−k)Tlast−(Tlast−k)Lambda\_z = -(slope) = \frac{ln(Clast)-ln(Clast-k)}{Tlast-(Tlast-k)} (Equation 5) k+1{k+1} number data points n{n} data samples used calculate regression line representing elimination phase. Clast plasma concentration corresponding last sampled time Tlast. elimination half-life (HL_Lambda_z) calculated Lambda_z using Equation 6. HL_Lambda_z=log2Lambda_zHL\_Lambda\_z = \frac{log2}{Lambda\_z} (Equation 6)

title: Introduction to the ncappc package
text: number tables produced ncappc tool. Descriptions tables . tables shown produced report tab separated value (.tsv) files, .e., columns tables separated tabs. “NaN” “NA” produced metric value irrelevant specified data type case.

title: Introduction to the ncappc package
text: estimated values NCA metrics individual along stratifiers (eg. population group ID, dose ID, etc.) specified input command. simulated data provided, table also reports three additional columns NCA metrics can used diagnostics. sim[metric_name] represents median metric obtained set simulated data. d[metric_name] represents deviation median simulated metrics metric obtained observed data, scaled “spread” simulated distribution (defined “spread” argument ncappc function). npde[metric_name] represents NPDE value metric estimated simulated data respect observed data.

title: Introduction to the ncappc package
text: set statistical parameters calculated entire population stratified population NCA metrics estimated observed data. Calculated statistical parameters : Ntot: Total number data points Nunique: number unique data points Min: minimum value Max: maximum value Mean: mean/average value SD: standard deviation SE: standard error CVp: coefficient variation percent a95CIu: upper limit 95% arithmetic confidence interval a95CIl: lower limit 95% arithmetic confidence interval gMean: geometric mean gCVp: geometric coefficient variation percent.

title: Introduction to the ncappc package
text: set statistical parameters calculated entire population stratified population NCA metrics estimated simulated data. table structured “ObsStat.tsv”.

title: Introduction to the ncappc package
text: table reports simulated concentration-time profiles individual obtained number simulations. Currently ncappc function accepts NONMEM output format simulated data. columns NONMEM output file kept unaltered file additional column, namely “NSUB”, printed denote corresponding simulation number concentration-time profile.

text: Estimated NCA metrics individual using simulated concentration-time profile obtained simulation. “NSUB” column denotes simulation number.

text: Concentration vs time profile individual stratified dose population group, , obtained observed data. left panels represent raw data, right panels represent semi-logarithmic form concentration data. lines represents individual data.

title: Introduction to the ncappc package
text: Histogram four selected NCA metrics (AUClast, AUCINF_obs, Cmax, Tmax) estimated observed data. solid blue vertical dotted lines represent population mean “spread” data. “spread” defined obtained observed data.

what: [Population level] Histogram of the simulated population means of the NCA metrics
title: Introduction to the ncappc package
text: Histogram population mean NCA metrics obtained simulated data. red blue solid vertical lines represent population mean NCA metric obtained observed data mean population means NCA metric obtained simulated data, respectively. blue dashed vertical lines represent “spread” simulated distribution. “spread” defined either defined standard deviation 95% nonparametric prediction interval population mean NCA metrics obtained simulated data.

what: [Individual level] Deviation of the simulated NCA metrics from the observed value
title: Introduction to the ncappc package
text: Deviation mean NCA metrics individual estimated simulated data (meanSim) corresponding values estimated observed data (Obs). deviation scaled boundary “spread” simulated data proximal observed value (** Deviation = (Obs - meanSim)/ spread **). negative value deviation signifies -prediction corresponding NCA metric, positive value deviation signifies -prediction .

what: [Individual level] Distribution of the simulated NCA metrics for the outliers}
title: Introduction to the ncappc package
text: Distribution NCA metrics obtained simulated data outlier individuals. individuals labeled outliers absolute value scaled deviation least one NCA metrics used diagnosis larger 1. red blue solid vertical lines represent observed NCA metric value mean simulated NCA metric values individual, respectively. dashed blue vertical lines represent “spread” simulated distribution.

what: [Population level] Histogram of the NPDE values of the NCA metrics within a given population group
title: Introduction to the ncappc package
text: Histogram NPDE values NCA metrics individuals within given population group. red solid vertical represents mean ideal NPDE distribution, theoretical normal distribution (mean=0, SD=1). blue solid vertical lines represent mean NPDE distribution corresponding population group. dashed blue vertical lines represent standard deviation distribution NPDE values within population group.

what: [Population level] Forest plot for the NPDE type analysis
title: Introduction to the ncappc package
text: Forest plot NPDE type analysis displaying mean standard deviation NPDE vaues NCA metrics different population groups. red green dots represent mean standard deviation NPDE, respectively horizontal red green lines represent corresponding 95% confidence intervals.

what: [Individual level] NPDE values of the NCA metrics for each individual
title: Introduction to the ncappc package
text: NPDE values NCA metrics individual within given population group calculated corresponding observed simulated values NCA metrics. negative value NPDE signifies -prediction corresponding NCA metric, positive value NPDE signifies -prediction .

title: Authors and Citation
text: Chayan Acharya. Author. Gulbeyaz Y. Turkyilmaz. Author. Siv Jonsson. Author. Mats O. Karlsson. Author. Andrew C. Hooker. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Acharya C, Hooker AC, Stroemberg EA, Turkyilmaz GY, Jonsson S, Karlsson MO (2016). “diagnostic tool population models using non-compartmental analysis: ncappc functionality R.” Computer Methods Programs Biomedicine, 127, 83-93.
code: @Article{,   title = {A diagnostic tool for population models using non-compartmental analysis: The ncappc functionality for R},   author = {Chayan Acharya and Andrew C Hooker and Eric A Stroemberg and Gulbeyaz Y Turkyilmaz and Siv Jonsson and Mats O Karlsson},   journal = {Computer Methods and Programs in Biomedicine},   year = {2016},   volume = {127},   pages = {83-93}, }

what: NCA Calculations and Population Model Diagnosis
title: NCA Calculations and Population Model Diagnosis
text: ncappc performs NCA Calculations population model diagnosis using posterior predictive checks generated data simulated population model. ncappc flexible tool can perform: Traditional non-compartmental analysis (NCA) Simulation-based posterior predictive checks population pharmacokinetic (PK) /pharmacodynamic (PKPD) models using NCA metrics. can read : website stable version ncappc website development version ncappc

title: NCA Calculations and Population Model Diagnosis
text: need R installed. Download latest version R www.r-project.org. can install latest stable release CRAN: can install development version ncappc GitHub :
code: install.packages("ncappc") # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("UUPharmacometrics/ncappc")

what: Calculates a set of statistics for a given array of numbers. — calc.stat
title: Calculates a set of statistics for a given array of numbers. — calc.stat
text: calc.stat calculates set statistics given array numbers.

title: Calculates a set of statistics for a given array of numbers. — calc.stat
code: calc.stat(x)

title: Calculates a set of statistics for a given array of numbers. — calc.stat
text: x numeric array

title: Calculates a set of statistics for a given array of numbers. — calc.stat
text: array calculated statistics given set numbers

title: Calculates a set of statistics for a given array of numbers. — calc.stat
text: calc.stat calculates set statistics given array numbers. calculated statistics Ntot = length array Nunique = Number unique elements Min = Minimum value array Max = Maximum value array Mean = Mean value array Median = Median value array SD = Standard deviation value array SE = Standard error value array CVp = Percent coefficient variation array CI95u = Upper limit 95% confidence interval array cI95l = Lower limit 95% confidence interval array gMean = Geometric mean value array gCVp = Geometric percent coefficient variation array

what: Plots drug plasma concentration vs time data — dv.plot
title: Plots drug plasma concentration vs time data — dv.plot
text: dv.plot plots DV vs Time data.

title: Plots drug plasma concentration vs time data — dv.plot
code: dv.plot(   df,   xvar = "Time",   yvar = "Conc",   obsLog = FALSE,   myXlab = "Time",   myYlab = "Concentration",   color = NULL,   group = NULL,   guide = TRUE,   onlyLin = FALSE,   onlyLog = FALSE,   XYlog = FALSE,   STRATY = ".",   STRATX = ".",   myYBr = waiver(),   myXBr = waiver(),   myYBrLog = waiver(),   myXBrLog = waiver(),   myYlim = NULL,   myXlim = NULL,   myYlimLog = NULL,   myXlimLog = NULL,   title = NULL )

title: Plots drug plasma concentration vs time data — dv.plot
text: df data frame used plot xvar independent variable, default "TIME" yvar dependent variable, default "DV" obsLog logical variable (TRUE, FALSE). TRUE, concentration observed data assumed logarithmic scale. Default FALSE myXlab x-axis label, default "Time" myYlab y-axis label, defaults "Concentration" color column name color stratification variable, e.g. "DOSEF". Default NULL group column name variable used group data, default "ID guide TRUE, show guide, default TRUE onlyLin TRUE, presents linear version plot, default FALSE onlyLog TRUE, presents log version plot, default FALSE XYlog TRUE, X Y axes log version plot shown logarithmic scale; FALSE, Y-axis shown logarithmic scale. Default FALSE. STRATY row stratification variable, default "." STRATX column stratification variable, default "." myYBr breaks Y-axis linear plot myXBr breaks X-axis linear plot myYBrLog breaks Y-axis log plot myXBrLog breaks X-axis log plot myYlim sets Y-axis limits linear plot myXlim sets X-axis limits linear plot myYlimLog sets Y-axis limit log plot myXlimLog sets X-axis limit log plot title title plot.

title: Plots drug plasma concentration vs time data — dv.plot
text: returns graphical object created arrangeGrob function

title: Plots drug plasma concentration vs time data — dv.plot

title: Estimate individual NCA metrics. — est.nca
text: Estimates comprehensive set NCA metrics given individual using concentration vs. time data.

title: Estimate individual NCA metrics. — est.nca
code: est.nca(   time,   conc,   backExtrp = FALSE,   negConcExcl = FALSE,   doseType = "ns",   adminType = "extravascular",   doseAmt = NULL,   method = "linearup-logdown",   AUCTimeRange = NULL,   LambdaTimeRange = NULL,   LambdaExclude = NULL,   doseTime = doseTime,   Tau = NULL,   TI = NULL,   simFile = NULL,   dset = "obs",   onlyNCA = FALSE,   extrapolate = FALSE,   sparse_compute = FALSE,   force_extrapolate = FALSE,   ... )

title: Estimate individual NCA metrics. — est.nca
text: time Numeric array time conc Numeric array concentration backExtrp back-extrapolation needed AUC (TRUE FALSE) (FALSE) negConcExcl Exclude -ve conc (FALSE) doseType Steady-state (ss) non-steady-state (ns) dose ("ns") adminType Route administration (iv-bolus,iv-infusion,extravascular) ("extravascular") doseAmt Dose amounts ("NULL") method Method estimate AUC. "linear" method applies linear trapezoidal rule estimate area curve. "log" method applies logarithmic trapezoidal rule estimate area curve. "linearup-logdown" method applies linear trapezoidal rule estimate area curve ascending part curve logarithmic trapezoidal rule estimate area curve descending part curve. AUCTimeRange User-defined window time used estimate AUC ("NULL") LambdaTimeRange User-defined window time estimate elimination rate-constant ("NULL") LambdaExclude User-defined excluded observation time points estimation elimination rate-constant ("NULL") doseTime Dose time prior first observation steady-state data (NULL) Tau Dosing interval steady-state data ("NULL") TI Infusion duration ("NULL") simFile Name simulated concentration-time data present ("NULL") dset Type, .e., observed simulated concentration-time data set ("obs" "sim") ("obs") onlyNCA TRUE NCA performed ppc part ignored although simFile NULL. Default FALSE extrapolate function extrapolate last observation infinity? sparse_compute NCA metrics computed even one sample? force_extrapolate Extrapolate AUC_inf sparse data.  Sparse data defined fewer 3 points Cmax non-bolus input.  case, Cmax included extrapolation one extra point required extrapolation. ... Arguments passed functions.  used.

title: Estimate individual NCA metrics. — est.nca
text: est.nca estimates comprehensive set NCA metrics using concentration-time profile individual. NCA metrics estimated according traditional PK calculations. names various NCA metrics estimated package assigned mainly following names used WinNonlin. package accepts three different types drug administration, () iv-bolus, (ii) iv-infusion (iii) extravascular; ncappc also can accept non-steady state steady-state data. NCA metrics estimated reported ncappc listed . C0 initial concentration dosing time.  observed concentration dosing time, available. Otherwise  approximated using following rules. Cmax, Tmax Cmax_D value time maximum  observed concentration, respectively. maximum concentration  unique, first maximum used. steady state data, maximum value  dosing intervals considered. Cmax_D dose normalized  maximum observed concentration. Clast Tlast last measurable positive  concentration corresponding time, respectively. AUClast area concentration vs. time curve  first observed last measurable concentration. AUMClast first moment concentration vs. time  curve first observed last measurable concentration. MRTlast mean residence time first observed  last measurable concentration. No_points_Lambda_z number observed data points  used determine best fitting regression line elimination  phase. AUC_pBack_Ext_obs percentage AUCINF_obs  contributed back extrapolation estimate C0. AUC_pBack_Ext_pred percentage AUCINF_pred  contributed back extrapolation estimate C0. AUClower_upper AUC concentration-time  profile within user-specified window time provided  "AUCTimeRange" argument. case empty "AUCTimeRange" argument,  AUClower_upper AUClast. Rsq, Rsq_adjusted Corr_XY regression coefficient  regression line used estimate elimination rate constant,  adjusted value Rsq square root Rsq, respectively. Lambda_z elimination rate constant estimated  regression line representing terminal phase concentration-time  data. Lambda_lower Lambda_upper lower upper limit  time values concentration-time profile used estimate  Lambda_z, respectively, case "LambdaTimeRange" used specify  time range. HL_Lambda_z terminal half-life drug. AUCINF_obs AUCINF_obs_D AUC estimated first  sampled data extrapolated infinity dose normalized version,  respectively. extrapolation terminal phase based last  observed concentration Clast_obs. AUC_pExtrap_obs percentage AUCINF_obs  contributed extrapolation last sampling time infinity. AUMCINF_obs AUMC estimated first sampled data  extrapolated infinity. extrapolation terminal phase based  last observed concentration. AUMC_pExtrap_obs percentage AUMCINF_obs  contributed extrapolation last sampling time infinity. Vz_obs volume distribution estimated based  total AUC Cl_obs total body clearance. AUCINF_pred AUCINF_pred_D AUC first sampled  data extrapolated infinity dose normalized version, respectively.  extrapolation terminal phase based last predicted  concentration obtained regression line used estimate Lambda_z  (Clast_pred). AUC_pExtrap_pred percentage AUCINF_pred  contributed extrapolation last sampling time infinity. AUMCINF_pred AUMC estimated first sampled data  extrapolated infinity. extrapolation terminal phase based  last predicted concentration obtained regression line used  estimate Lambda_z (Clast_pred). AUMC_pExtrap_pred percentage AUMCINF_pred  contributed extrapolation last sampling time infinity. Vz_pred volume distribution estimated based  AUCINF_pred. Cl_pred total body clearance estimated based  AUCINF_pred. MRTINF_obs mean residence time first  sampled time extrapolated infinity based last observed  concentration (Clast_obs). MRTINF_pred mean residence time first  sampled time extrapolated infinity based last predicted  concentration obtained regression line used estimate Lambda_z  (Clast_pred). Tau dosing interval steady-state data. Cmin Tmin minimum concentration 0  Tau corresponding time, respectively. Cavg average concentration 0 Tau  steady-state data. AUCtau AUMCtau AUC AUMC 0 Tau  steady-state data. Clss estimate total body clearance  steady-state data. Vss_obs Vss_pred estimated volume distribution  steady-state based Clast_obs Clast_pred, respectively. p_Fluctuation percentage fluctuation  concentration 0 Tau steady-state data. Accumulation_Index \(1/(1-e^(-\lambda_z*\tau))\)

title: Check observed data — nca.check.obs
text: nca.check.obs Checks observed data compatibility ncappc processes data various filtering criteria.

title: Check observed data — nca.check.obs
code: nca.check.obs(   obsData,   idNmObs = "ID",   timeNmObs = "TIME",   concNmObs = "DV",   doseType = "ns",   doseTime = NULL,   Tau = NULL,   filterNm = NULL,   filterExcl = NULL,   str1Nm = NULL,   str1 = NULL,   str2Nm = NULL,   str2 = NULL,   str3Nm = NULL,   str3 = NULL,   AUCTimeRange = NULL,   LambdaTimeRange = NULL,   adminType = "extravascular",   TI = NULL,   doseAmtNm = NULL,   dateColNm = NULL,   dateFormat = NULL,   timeFormat = "number",   concUnit = NULL,   timeUnit = NULL,   doseUnit = NULL,   blqNm = NULL,   blqExcl = 1,   evid = TRUE,   evidIncl = 0,   mdv = FALSE )

title: Check observed data — nca.check.obs
text: obsData Observed concentration-time data. idNmObs Column name ID observed data. Default "ID" timeNmObs Column name time observed data. Default "TIME" concNmObs Column name concentration observed data. Default "DV" doseType Steady-state (ss) non-steady-state (ns) dose. Default "ns" doseTime Dose time prior first observation steady-state data. Default NULL Tau Dosing interval steady-state data. Default NULL filterNm Column name filter data. Default NULL filterExcl Row exclusion criteria based column defined filterNm. can numeric value logical condition (e.g. c(1, 2, "<20", ">=100", "!=100")). Default NULL str1Nm Column name 1st level population stratifier. Default NULL str1 Stratification ID members within 1st level stratification (e.g c(1,2)). Default NULL str2Nm Column name 2nd level population stratifier. Default NULL str2 Stratification ID members within 2nd level stratification (e.g c(1,2)). Default NULL str3Nm Column name 3rd level population stratifier. Default NULL str3 Stratification ID members within 3rd level stratification (e.g c(1,2)). Default NULL AUCTimeRange User-defined window time used estimate AUC. Default NULL LambdaTimeRange User-defined window time estimate elimination rate-constant. argument lets user choose specific window time used estimate elimination rate constant (Lambda) elimination phase. accepted format input argument numeric array two elements; c(14,24) estimate Lambda using data within time units 14 24. Default NULL adminType Route administration. Allowed options iv-bolus, iv-infusion extravascular. Default "extravascular" TI Infusion duration. TI single numeric value, TI individuals. TI name column numeric data present data set, TI set unique value column given individual. Default NULL doseAmtNm Column name specify dose amount. Default NULL dateColNm column name date used (e.g. "Date", "DATE"). Default NULL dateFormat date format (D-M-Y, D/M/Y combination D,M,Y). Default NULL timeFormat time format (number, H:M, H:M:S). Default "number" concUnit Unit concentration (e.g. "ng/mL"). Default NULL timeUnit Unit time (e.g. "h"). Default NULL doseUnit Unit dose amount (e.g. "ng"). Default NULL blqNm Name BLQ column used exclude data. Default NULL blqExcl Excluded BLQ value; either numeric value logical condition (e.g. 1 ">=1" c(1,">3")). Used blqNm NULL. Default "1" evid TRUE EVID used filter data. Default TRUE evidIncl Included values EVID. Default "0" mdv TRUE MDV used include data MDV=0. Default FALSE

Default NULL filterExcl Row exclusion criteria based column defined filterNm. can numeric value logical condition (e.g. c(1, 2, "<20", ">=100", "!=100")). Default NULL str1Nm Column name 1st level population stratifier. Default NULL str1 Stratification ID members within 1st level stratification (e.g c(1,2)). Default NULL str2Nm Column name 2nd level population stratifier. Default NULL str2 Stratification ID members within 2nd level stratification (e.g c(1,2)). Default NULL str3Nm Column name 3rd level population stratifier. Default NULL str3 Stratification ID members within 3rd level stratification (e.g c(1,2)). Default NULL adminType Route administration. Allowed options iv-bolus, iv-infusion extravascular. Default "extravascular" TI Infusion duration. TI single numeric value, TI individuals. TI name column numeric data present data set, TI set unique value column given individual. Default NULL doseAmtNm Column name specify dose amount. Default NULL blqNm Name BLQ column used exclude data. Default NULL blqExcl Excluded BLQ value; either numeric value logical condition (e.g. 1 ">=1" c(1,">3")). Used blqNm NULL. Default "1" evid TRUE EVID used filter data. Default TRUE evidIncl Included values EVID. Default "0" mdv TRUE MDV used include data MDV=0. Default FALSE

Allowed options iv-bolus, iv-infusion extravascular. Default "extravascular" TI Infusion duration. TI single numeric value, TI individuals. TI name column numeric data present data set, TI set unique value column given individual. Default NULL dateColNm column name date used (e.g. "Date", "DATE"). Default NULL dateFormat date format (D-M-Y, D/M/Y combination D,M,Y). Default NULL timeFormat time format (number, H:M, H:M:S). Default "number"

(c("AUClast", "Cmax")) cunit Unit concentration (default NULL) tunit Unit time (default NULL) noPlot Perform NCA calculations without plot generation (TRUE, FALSE) (FALSE) onlyNCA TRUE NCA performed ppc part ignored although simFile NULL. Default FALSE

text: nca.pde.deviation.outlier calculates individual prediction distribution errors (PDE) scaled deviation NCA metrics estimated observed simulated data. deviation estimated NCA metrics scaled "spread" simulated values. "spread" measured either 95% parametric prediction interval 95% non-parametric prediction interval. individual yielding absolute value scaled deviation selected NCA metrics greater 1, assigned outlier corresponding population PK model. allowed NCA metrics diagnostic tests "AUClast", "AUClower_upper", "AUCINF_obs", "AUCINF_pred", "AUMClast", "Cmax", "Tmax" "HL_Lambda_z". default, function uses AUClast Cmax metrics comparison.

what: Performs NCA calculations and population PK model diagnosis. — ncappc
title: Performs NCA calculations and population PK model diagnosis. — ncappc
text: ncappc flexible tool, perform traditional NCA perform simulation-based posterior predictive checks population PK model using NCA metrics.

title: Performs NCA calculations and population PK model diagnosis. — ncappc
code: ncappc(   obsFile = "nca_original.npctab.dta",   simFile = "nca_simulation.1.npctab.dta.zip",   str1Nm = NULL,   str1 = NULL,   str2Nm = NULL,   str2 = NULL,   str3Nm = NULL,   str3 = NULL,   concUnit = NULL,   timeUnit = NULL,   doseUnit = NULL,   obsLog = FALSE,   simLog = obsLog,   psnOut = TRUE,   idNmObs = "ID",   timeNmObs = "TIME",   concNmObs = "DV",   idNmSim = idNmObs,   timeNmSim = timeNmObs,   concNmSim = concNmObs,   onlyNCA = FALSE,   AUCTimeRange = NULL,   backExtrp = FALSE,   LambdaTimeRange = NULL,   LambdaExclude = NULL,   doseAmtNm = NULL,   adminType = "extravascular",   doseType = "ns",   doseTime = NULL,   Tau = NULL,   TI = NULL,   method = "linearup-logdown",   blqNm = NULL,   blqExcl = 1,   evid = TRUE,   evidIncl = 0,   mdv = FALSE,   filterNm = NULL,   filterExcl = NULL,   negConcExcl = FALSE,   param = c("AUClast", "Cmax"),   timeFormat = "number",   dateColNm = NULL,   dateFormat = NULL,   spread = "npi",   tabCol = c("AUClast", "Cmax", "Tmax", "AUCINF_obs", "Vz_obs", "Cl_obs", "HL_Lambda_z"),   figFormat = "tiff",   noPlot = FALSE,   printOut = TRUE,   studyName = NULL,   new_data_method = TRUE,   overwrite_SIMDATA = NULL,   overwrite_sim_est_file = NULL,   outFileNm = NULL,   out_format = "html",   gg_theme = theme_bw(),   parallel = FALSE,   extrapolate = FALSE,   timing = FALSE,   ... )

title: Performs NCA calculations and population PK model diagnosis. — ncappc
text: obsFile Observed concentration-time data internal data frame external table comma, tab space separators. simFile NONMEM simulation output simulated concentration-time data internal data frame external table. NULL produces just NCA output, filename data frame produces NCA output well PopPK diagnosis. new_data_method=TRUE can compressed file well. str1Nm Column name 1st level population stratifier. Default NULL str1 Stratification ID members within 1st level stratification (e.g c(1,2)). Default NULL str2Nm Column name 2nd level population stratifier. Default NULL str2 Stratification ID members within 2nd level stratification (e.g c(1,2)). Default NULL str3Nm Column name 3rd level population stratifier. Default NULL str3 Stratification ID members within 3rd level stratification (e.g c(1,2)). Default NULL concUnit Unit concentration (e.g. "ng/mL"). Default NULL timeUnit Unit time (e.g. "h"). Default NULL doseUnit Unit dose amount (e.g. "ng"). Default NULL obsLog TRUE concentration observed data logarithmic scale. Default FALSE simLog TRUE concentration simulated data logarithmic scale. Default FALSE psnOut TRUE observed data output PsN NONMEM output format. Default TRUE idNmObs Column name ID observed data. Default "ID" timeNmObs Column name time observed data. Default "TIME" concNmObs Column name concentration observed data. Default "DV" idNmSim Column name ID simulated data. Default "ID" timeNmSim Column name time simulated data. Default "TIME" concNmSim Column name concentration simulated data. Default "DV" onlyNCA TRUE NCA performed ppc part ignored although simFile NULL. Default FALSE AUCTimeRange User-defined window time used estimate AUC. Default NULL backExtrp TRUE back-extrapolation performed estimating AUC. Default FALSE LambdaTimeRange User-defined window time estimate elimination rate-constant. argument lets user choose specific window time used estimate elimination rate constant (Lambda) elimination phase. accepted format input argument numeric array two elements; c(14,24) estimate Lambda using data within time units 14 24. Default NULL LambdaExclude User-defined excluded observation time points estimation Lambda. can numeric value logical condition (e.g. c(1, 2, "<20", ">=100", "!=100")). Default NULL doseAmtNm Column name specify dose amount. Default NULL adminType Route administration. Allowed options iv-bolus, iv-infusion extravascular. Default "extravascular" doseType Steady-state (ss) non-steady-state (ns) dose. Default "ns" doseTime Dose time prior first observation steady-state data. Default NULL Tau Dosing interval steady-state data. Default NULL TI Infusion duration. TI single numeric value, TI individuals. TI name column numeric data present data set, TI set unique value column given individual. Default NULL method Method estimate AUC. linear method applies linear trapezoidal rule estimate area curve. log method applies logarithmic trapezoidal rule estimate area curve. linearup-logdown method applies linear trapezoidal rule estimate area curve ascending part curve logarithmic trapezoidal rule estimate area curve descending part curve. Default "linearup-logdown" blqNm Name BLQ column used exclude data. Default NULL blqExcl Excluded BLQ value; either numeric value logical condition (e.g. 1 ">=1" c(1,">3")). Used blqNm NULL. Default "1" evid TRUE EVID used filter data. Default TRUE evidIncl Included values EVID. Default "0" mdv TRUE MDV used include data MDV=0. Default FALSE filterNm Column name filter data. Default NULL filterExcl Row exclusion criteria based column defined filterNm. can numeric value logical condition (e.g. c(1, 2, "<20", ">=100", "!=100")). Default NULL negConcExcl TRUE negative concentrations excluded. Default FALSE param NCA parameters (AUClast, AUClower_upper, AUCINF_obs, AUCINF_pred, AUMClast, Cmax, Tmax, HL_Lambda_z). Default (c"AUClast", "Cmax") timeFormat time format (number, H:M, H:M:S). Default "number" dateColNm column name date used (e.g. "Date", "DATE"). Default NULL dateFormat date format (D-M-Y, D/M/Y combination D,M,Y). Default NULL spread Measure spread simulated data ("ppi" (95% parametric prediction interval) "npi" (95% nonparametric prediction interval)). Default "npi" tabCol Output columns printed report addition ID, dose population strata information (list NCA metrics string array). Default c("AUClast", "Cmax", "Tmax", "AUCINF_obs", "Vz_obs", "Cl_obs", "HL_Lambda_z") figFormat format produced figures (bmp, jpeg, tiff, png). Default "tiff" noPlot TRUE NCA calculations performed without plot generation. Default FALSE printOut TRUE tabular graphical outputs saved disk. Default TRUE studyName Name study added description report. Default NULL new_data_method TRUE faster method reading data tested. Default TRUE overwrite_SIMDATA TRUE new information created SIMDATA directory. FALSE information SIMDATA directory used. NULL dialog come ask user . Default NULL overwrite_sim_est_file TRUE NCA metrics created based simulation data.  FALSE information ncaSimEst file   used. NULL dialog come ask user .   Default NULL outFileNm Additional tag name output html pdf output file hyphenated standard ncappc report file name standard ncappc report file name. Default NULL out_format type output format NCA report ? Pass "" render formats defined within rmarkdown file. Pass "first" render first format defined within rmarkdown file. Pass "html" render HTML. Pass "pdf" render PDF. gg_theme ggplot theme used plots? parallel nca computations simulated data run parallel? See start_parallel description additional arguments can added function passed start_parallel. extrapolate NCA calculations extrapolate last observation infinity? timing timings calculations reported screen? ... Additional arguments passed functions, including start_parallel.

text: NCA results diagnostic test results

title: Performs NCA calculations and population PK model diagnosis. — ncappc
text: Non-compartmental analysis (NCA) calculates pharmacokinetic (PK) metrics related systemic exposure drug following administration, e.g. area concentration-time curve peak concentration. ncappc performs traditional NCA using observed plasma concentration-time data. presence simulated plasma concentration-time data, ncappc also performs simulation-based posterior predictive checks (ppc) using NCA metrics corresponding population PK (PopPK) model used generate simulated data. diagnostic analysis performed population well individual level. distribution simulated population means NCA metric compared corresponding observed population mean. individual level comparison performed based deviation mean NCA metric based simulations individual corresponding NCA metric obtained observed data. Additionally, ncappc reports normalized prediction distribution error (NPDE) simulated NCA metrics individual distribution within population. ncappc produces two default outputs depending type analysis performed, .e., traditional NCA PopPK diagnosis. PopPK diagnosis feature ncappc produces 7 sets graphical outputs assess ability population model simulate concentration-time profile drug thereby identify model misspecification. addition, tabular outputs generated showing values NCA metrics estimated observed simulated data, along deviation, NPDE, regression parameters used estimate elimination rate constant related population statistics. default values arguments used ncappc shown Usage section document /bold Arguments section.

title: Performs NCA calculations and population PK model diagnosis. — ncappc
code: out <- ncappc(obsFile=system.file("extdata","pkdata.csv",package="ncappc"),    onlyNCA = TRUE,   extrapolate = TRUE,   printOut = FALSE,   evid = FALSE,   psnOut=FALSE)     data_1 <- data.frame(   ID=1,   TIME = c(0,0.25,0.5,1,1.5,2,3,4,6,8,12,16,24),   DV=c(0, 0.07, 0.14, 0.21, 0.24, 0.27, 0.26, 0.25, 0.22, 0.19, 0.13, 0.081, 0.033) ) out_1 <- ncappc(obsFile=data_1,                 onlyNCA = TRUE,                 extrapolate = TRUE,                 printOut = FALSE,                 evid = FALSE,                 timing=TRUE) #> Time taken to estimate NCA parameters on observed data: 0.023 seconds.   data_2 <- dplyr::filter(data_1,TIME>17|TIME<3) out_2 <- ncappc(obsFile=data_2,                 onlyNCA = TRUE,                 extrapolate = TRUE,                 printOut = FALSE,                 evid = FALSE,                 force_extrapolate=TRUE)

what: Read NONMEM table files produced. — read_nm_table
title: Read NONMEM table files produced. — read_nm_table
text: function reads NONMEM table files.  files can created $EST line $SIM line NONMEM model file.

title: Read NONMEM table files produced. — read_nm_table
code: read_nm_table(   nm_table,   only_obs = FALSE,   method = "default",   quiet = TRUE,   sim_num = FALSE,   sim_name = "NSIM",   verbose = FALSE )

title: Read NONMEM table files produced. — read_nm_table
text: nm_table NONMEM table file read. text string. dplyr readr available method="default" method="readr_*" nm_table can either path file, connection, literal data (either single string raw vector). Files ending .gz, .bz2, .xz, .zip automatically uncompressed. Files starting http://, https://, ftp://, ftps:// automatically downloaded. Remote gz files can also automatically downloaded & decompressed. only_obs non-observation lines data set removed? Currently filtered using expected MDV column. TRUE FALSE. method Can one default, readr_1,  readr_2, readr_3, slow. readr_1 fastest.  slow require dplyr readr (version >= 0.2.2). quiet verbose messages function ? sim_num function add column returned data frame identifies simulation number (present)? sim_name name resulting column returned data frame sim_num true. verbose output verbose error checking?

title: Read NONMEM table files produced. — read_nm_table
text: Returns data frame simulated table added column   simulation number. data frame given class c("tbl_df",   "tbl", "data.frame") easy use dplyr.

title: Read NONMEM table files produced. — read_nm_table
text: Currently function searches $TABLE multiple header lines, uses identify multiple simulations. function expects least one header line  (NOHEADER option allowed NONMEM table files).

title: ncappc 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-08-24 New mean variance NCA metrics histogram plots Updating reports generated standardizing appear Change estimate_nca works, making tidy calculations default assuring function works real simulated data Added parallel computation NCA metrics simulated data Added number automatic tests used checking package includung results ncappc publication. Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Fixed depencies ggplot2, grid scales Updated vignettes examples added documentation Allowing extrapolation fewer three points elimination phase profile Allow timing messages turned . Bug fixes linear-log option changed linearup-logdown Central tendency measure NCA metrics changed mean median Updated documentation Changed package maintainer MRTINF pitfall fixed Added continuous integration Made onlyNCA work
